item.title: All Hisuian Forms in Pokemon GO (& How to Get Them)
item.description:
With the "Ultra Unlock: Hisui Celebration" event, almost every Pokemon from the Hisui region can now be caught in Pokemon GO . As their titles indicate, Hisuian Pokemon are Pokemon that were first spotted and registered in the Hisui region. While there are some never-before-seen species such as Overqwil and Sneasler, there are some returning Pokemon that have a regional form, such as Growlithe and Voltorb. Despite this, the way of obtaining the Hisuian Pokemon in Pokemon GO is different from the mainline games. Many evolved Hisuian Pokemon are raid-exclusive, so it's best to know which ones you can and can't catch in the wild.

Every Hisuian Pokemon in Pokemon GO (July 2025)

Hisuian Growlithe & Hisuian Arcanine

Hisuian Growlithe and Hisuian Arcanine are Fire/Rock-type Pokemon. They first appeared in Pokemon GO during the "Hisuian Discoveries" event on July 27, 2022. As of July 2025, you can find Hisuian Growlithe in the wild. The appearance rate of Hisuian Growlithe is influenced by any in-game events or the weather. If you want to evolve Hisuian Growlithe into Hisuian Arcanine, you'll need 50 Growlithe Candies.

Hisuian Voltorb & Hisuian Electrode

Both Hisuian Voltorb and Hisuian Electrode are Electric/Grass-type. Hisuian Voltorb was the first Hisuian Pokemon to appear in Pokemon GO by completing the "Voltorb from the Hisui Region?! " Special Research on January 30, 2022. However, it wouldn't be able to evolve until the following month (February 18, 2022), which marked the debut of Hisuian Electrode. You can find Hisuian Voltorb in the wild in Pokemon GO , but you can also hatch it from 7km Eggs.

Pokemon obtained via eggs will change over time. Meaning that although this method of getting Hisuian Voltorb exists now, it may not in the future.

Kleavor

Bug/Rock-type Kleavor is a new addition to the Scyther evolution line. Like Slowpoke and its evolutions, you have the option of evolving Scyther into two different Pokemon. As of Pokemon GO 's Kleavor Raid Day (May 6, 2023), you can catch your own Kleavor from 3-star raids . If you're lucky, you could get a Shiny Kleavor!

Currently, you can't evolve Scyther into Kleavor in GO , and it's unknown whether this will change in the future.

Hisuian Typhlosion

Hisuian Typhlosion was met with mixed reactions from the fanbase when it was first revealed in Pokemon Legends: Arceus . Despite this, the Fire/Ghost-type regional form grew popular over time thanks to its design and signature move.

Hisuian Typhlosion is the final evolved form of Cyndaquil, the Fire-type starter of the Johto region. However, you won't be able to evolve Cyndaquil/Quilava into Hisuian Typhlosion like you can in Legends: Arceus . Trying to do so will result in your Quilava evolving into the original/Johto Typhlosion. If you want Hisuian Typhlosion in Pokemon GO , you'll need to battle it in 3-star raids.

Hisuian Qwilfish & Overqwil

Hisuian Qwilfish and Overqwil are Dark/Poison-type Pokemon. Alongside Hisuian Growlithe and Hisuian Sneasel, Hisuian Qwilfish and Overqwil were made available during the "Hisuian Discoveries" event in GO . Both forms of Qwilfish exist in Pokemon GO , but only the Hisuian version can evolve into Overqwil.

Hisuian Qwilfish can be caught in the wild or hatched from 7km Eggs, like Hisuian Voltorb. If you want Overqwil, you'll need to evolve Hisuian Qwilfish and complete its Buddy Task. To do this, s et Hisuian Qwilfish as your Buddy , then defeat 10 raids . You'll also need 50 Qwilfish Candy to trigger the evolution.

Wyrdeer

Normal/Psychic-type Wyrdeer is the long-awaited evolved form of Stantler, a Normal-type reindeer Pokemon from the Johto region. To evolve Stantler into Wyrdeer in the mainline games, you needed the help of its signature move: Psyshield Bash. In Pokemon GO , you can't evolve Stantler into Wyrdeer. The only way to get Wyrdeer is through 3-star raids. However, Wyrdeer's debut event, "Winter Wonderland," ended in December 2023. Thus, the only time it'll spawn at raids/gyms is during another Hisui-themed event.

Hisuian Sneasel & Sneasler

Hisuian Sneasel and Sneasler first appeared in "Hisuian Discoveries" event with Hisuian Growlithe, Hisuian Arcanine, Hisuian Qwilfish, and Overqwil. To contrast with its Johto version, Hisuian Sneasel is a Fighting/Poison-type, a typing combination that it shares with its evolution, Sneasler. Fighting/Poison-type gives Hisuian Sneasel type advantages and disadvantages that Dark/Ice-type Sneasel does not possess.

Originally, you could hatch Hisuian Sneasel from 7km Eggs in Pokemon GO , but it's since been removed from the egg pool. Fortunately, you can catch Hisuian Sneasel in the wild. If you want to get Sneasler, you'll need to evolve Hisuian Sneasel. To do so, you'll need to meet the following requirements:

  1. Set Hisuian Sneasel as your buddy.
  2. Walk 7km .
  3. Evolve it during the day .
  4. Give it 100 Sneasel Candies.

Sneasler is exclusive to Hisuian Sneasel. You can't get it by evolving the Sneasel from Johto. Likewise, you can't evolve a Hisuian Sneasel into Weavile.

Ursaluna

Ground/Normal-type Ursaluna is the third and final form of the Teddiursa line. It was made available in Pokemon GO during the Teddiursa Community Day on November 12, 2002. You won't be able to find Ursaluna in the wild, but you can get it by evolving Ursaring. You'll need 100 Teddiursa Candies, and it will need to be a full moon in real time. This means you can only evolve your Ursaring into Ursaluna once a month. Be sure you have enough Teddiursa Candy when the time comes, or you'll have to wait another month.

Pokemon Scarlet/Violet 's expansion pass introduced a unique form of Ursaluna called Bloodmoon Ursaluna. This version of Ursaluna has yet to be seen in Pokemon GO . It's likely it will debut as a raid Pokemon since you can't evolve Ursaring into Bloodmoon Ursaluna.

Hisuian Samurott

Like Hisuian Typhlosion, Hisuian Samurott served as the final evolution of Oshawott, the Water-type starter of the Unova and Hisui region. In Legends: Arceus , any Dewott transferred to Hisui would evolve into Hisuian Samurott. If evolved elsewhere, it'd become the Unova/original Samurott. Hisuian Samurott's typing is Water/Dark, contrasting with the single Water-type of regular Samurott.

Currently, you can't evolve Dewott into Hisuian Samurott in Pokemon GO . The only way to get Hisuian Samurott is to battle one in 3-star raids. Due to its Water/Dark-typing, Hisuian Samurott is weak to Electric, Grass, Fighting, and Fairy-type moves. Keep this in mind when you go to battle it.

Hisuian Lilligant

Grass/Fighting-type Hisuian Lilligant sprung into Pokemon GO on July 12, 2025 as a 3-star Raid Pokemon from 2:00pm - 5:00pm local. If you were lucky, you may have caught her shiny form. You can't evolve Petilil into HIsuian Lilligant in Pokemon GO ; you can only get it via raids. Evolving Petilil with 50 Petilil Candies and a Sun Stone will result in the original/Unova Lilligant. If you missed your chance to get Hisuian Lilligant this past Raid Day (July 12, 2025), you may have the opportunity to get one sometime later.

Due to her dual Grass/Fighting-type, Hisuian Lilligant is extremely weak to Flying-type moves. If you get the chance to battle her in the future, you'll want to bring your best Flying-type to the raid match.

Hisuian Braviary

Unlike regular Braviary, Hisuian Braviary is a dual Psychic/Flying-type. As you'd expect, Hisuian Braviary is the evolved form of a Rufflet that's reached level 54 in Hisui. Since levels don't exist in Pokemon GO , you only need 50 Rufflet Candies to evolve it into regular/Unova Braviary. However, the Hisuian Braviary can't evolve from Rufflet in Pokemon GO . If you want to catch a Hisuian Braviary, you should look for 3-star raids during Hisui in-game events. The Battle Cry Pokemon could be added to your storage as far back as July 31, 2022 during the Hisuian Discoveries Raid Day.

Hisuian Zorua & Hisuian Zoroark

From July 8, 2025 to July 13, 2025, Pokemon GO has its "Ultra Unlock: Hisui Celebration" event. This features the debut of Hisuian Zorua and Zoroark as well as the shiny forms of Hisuian Voltorb and Hisuian Qwilfish.

Hisuian Zorua's sad Pokedex entry quickly attracted attention from fans, making it quite popular on arrival. While Unova Zorua and Zoroark are Dark-types, Hisuian Zorua and Hisuian Zoroark are Normal-Ghost-types. Much like the regular Zorua, Hisuian Zorua will disguise itself as your Buddy Pokemon in the wild on your in-game map. To make it easier to spot, you should set a Shiny Pokemon or a Legendary/Mythical as a Buddy.

To get Hisuian Zoroark, evolve Hisuian Zorua with 50 Zorua Candies.

Hisuian Avalugg

Bergmite that evolve into the Hisui region become Hisuian Avalugg when they reach level 37. Getting Hisuian Avalugg in Pokemon GO is an entirely different process, and evolving Bergmite into its Hisuian evolution is currently not possible.

One way to catch a Hisuian Avalugg is to complete the "Hisui Celebration Collection Challenge: Space-Time Distortion" during the "Ultra Unlock: Hisui Celebration" event (ends July 13, 2025). The Ice/Rock-type served as an encounter reward for completing the Timed Research tasks.

If you didn't complete this task on time, then your next method of getting the Hisuian Avalugg is through 3-star raids, much like the other evolved Hisuian Pokemon (ex: Hisuian Samurott, Kleavor, Wyrdeer). You'll want to keep an eye out for in-game Hisui events for a potential Hisuian Avalugg raid.

Hisuian Decidueye

Like the other two Legends: Arceus starter Pokemon, you can get Grass/Fighting-type Hisuian Decidueye through 3-star raids. Hisuian Decidueye made its debut into Pokemon GO on February 11, 2024 during Hisuian Decidueye Raid Day. It shares its typing with Hisuian Lilligant, so if you're battling it, you should target it with Flying-type Pokemon. Finally, as you most likely guessed by now, you can't evolve Dartrix, the first of Rowlet's evolution line, into Hisuian Decidueye in Pokemon GO . Meaning you'll have to keep an eye out for 3-star raids during Hisuian-themed events if you want to add Hisuian Decidueye to your Pokedex.

Missing Hisuian Pokemon (July 2025)

Fortunately, most Hisuian Pokemon have been added to Pokemon GO . As time goes on, we'll likely get the rest of the Pokemon from the Hisui region as well as their Shiny Forms. As of July 2025, the following Pokemon cannot be obtained in Pokemon GO , but will more than likely debut during the next Hisui event:

Pokemon

* White-Stripe Basculin

Basculegion

Hisuian Sliggoo

Hisuian Goodra

* White-Stripe Basculin is just another form of Basculin like the Red and Blue-Stripe, and it's debatable whether White-Stripe Basculin qualifies as a Pokemon from Hisui (like Hisuian Qwilfish). Unlike Red/Blue-stripe, White-Stripe is capable of evolving into Basculegion. Regardless, GO has yet to add White-Stripe Basculin to the game, meaning it and its evolution are currently unavailable as of July 2025.

item.title: Even Without a New Animal Crossing, Switch 2 Owners Are Spoiled for Choice
item.description:
Animal Crossing was always a fairly well-known franchise, but the series' latest installment, Animal Crossing: New Horizons , propelled its popularity to new heights. Animal Crossing: New Horizons was released in March 2020, right at the start of the COVID-19 pandemic. Since everyone was stuck at home back then, the video game industry experienced a huge commercial boom during this period. Out of all the franchises that had a major resurgence due to the stay-at-home orders, though, Animal Crossing was among the most prominent. Animal Crossing : New Horizons sold over 47 million copies in roughly 5 years, comfortably surpassing 2012's Animal Crossing: New Leaf in sales and becoming the second best-selling Nintendo Switch game of all time.

The Nintendo 3DS exclusive , Animal Crossing: New Leaf , is the second-best-selling installment in the Animal Crossing franchise. It sold around 13 million units worldwide, which is less than half of what New Horizons sold.

Despite Animal Crossing: New Horizons 's unprecedented success, Nintendo hasn't shared even a hint of information about a potential sequel to the game. There are typically long gaps of time between the release of each mainline Animal Crossing game, so although Nintendo's silence isn't that surprising, it begs the question of when the company will ever return to the franchise. The Nintendo Switch 2 was launched only a month ago, and since there aren't a lot of first-party exclusives announced for the system yet, now seems like the perfect time for Nintendo to reveal a new mainline Animal Crossing game. Even if a successor to New Horizons isn't released anytime soon, though, there are a lot of other Animal Crossing -esque games releasing on Switch 2 that kind of scratch the same itch.

There Are Plenty of Great Games Similar to Animal Crossing on Nintendo Switch 2

The Nintendo Switch 2 Launched With Two High-Quality Life Simulation Games

Life simulation franchises like Animal Crossing have always had a pretty prominent presence on Nintendo consoles, but in the last few years, it feels like there have been more high-quality games in the genre than ever before. The Nintendo Switch 2, in fact, launched with two critically acclaimed life sim titles, Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma and Fantasy Life i: The Girl Who Steals Time . Rune Factory is one of Japanese developer Marvelous' longest-running franchises, and although it has veered more into the RPG direction than Animal Crossing , it still shares many similar elements with the series.

Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma , in particular, allows players to grow crops, build relationships with NPCs, and customize villages, among other things.

The other life sim game that was launched alongside the Switch 2, Level-5's Fantasy Life i , has a lot of the same gameplay concepts as Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma . In this title, however, players are primarily tasked with rebuilding a damaged island using time travel and engaging in quests issued by local NPCS. Fantasy Life i has a cute chibi art style, similar to Animal Crossing , and it's a worthy successor to the original Fantasy Life on the Nintendo 3DS.

Hello Kitty Island Adventure is Like Animal Crossing But With More Exploration

In addition to these Switch 2 launch games, there are a handful of other modern Animal Crossing -inspired titles that are playable via backwards compatibility on Nintendo's current-gen console. One of these titles, for example, is Hello Kitty Island Adventure . Developed by Colorado-based studio Sunblink, this life simulation game was initially launched as an Apple Arcade exclusive a few years ago, but it finally made its way to Nintendo Switch and PC in early 2025.

The game is pretty similar to Animal Crossing: New Horizons in concept, but it has a lot more exploration-based gameplay. Hello Kitty Island Adventure features 3D platforming and puzzle-solving segments, as well as some optional side activities, such as house furnishing and cooking.

Disney Dreamlight Valley Has Received Major Content Updates for Multiple Years

Gamers who are looking for a life simulation game that has received years of support and updates may want to check out Disney Dreamlight Valley , as well. This Gameloft-developed title lets players live in a fantasy world alongside their favorite Disney characters, from Wall-E and Aladdin, all the way to Mike Wazowski and Maleficent. While Disney Dreamlight Valley does place a greater emphasis on storytelling compared to Animal Crossing , it is still very much a life simulation game at its core. Best of all, since the game still gets new content regularly (much like Hello Kitty Island Adventure ), players will have a hard time running out of things to do.

item.title: Persona 5 The Phantom X: Crossroads of Fate (Kamoshida's Palace) Walkthrough
item.description:
Persona 5 The Phantom X 's first event is a crossover, where the Phantom Thieves of the original Persona 5 join the cast of The Phantom X to explore a recreation of Kamoshida's Castle. Split over 14 missions, this exploration is filled with optional objectives and additional collectibles to find.

This guide will explain how to 100% clear every mission in the Castle Arc of Persona 5 The Phantom X , offering detailed info on where each collectible can be found and offering advice on the weaknesses of the stronger enemies.

Updated on July 13th, 2025, by Thomas Hawkins: This guide has now been updated to cover all 14 of the missions that make up the Castle Arc Event, including the locations of all collectibles and strategies for handling the final boss.

Crossroads of Fate: Castle Arc, Explained

The Crossroads of Fate: Castle Arc is the main focus of the Take Your Heart Event, and features the Phantom Thieves of Persona 5 and Persona 5: The Phantom X crossing paths in a strange recreation of Kamoshida's Palace. The exploration of the Palace is broken down into 14 Missions, which will be released in segments throughout the event duration, likely culminating in a boss fight against Shadow Kamoshida (if the Icon for Mission 14 is anything to go by).

This guide will explain how to 100% clear each of the 14 missions, updating periodically to include information on the missions as they become available in-game, including the locations of optional bosses, treasure chests, and the Orbs of Greed/Golden Volleyballs scattered throughout the Castle.

Crossroads of Fate: Castle Arc - 1-1 Walkthrough

This first mission is mostly story-driven and acts as an introduction to the event and its structure. It shows how the Phantom Thieves end up at Kamoshida's Palace, introduces them to Mona and Skull, and features a short battle alongside them against some Shadows. There are no collectibles to find in this first section, and the enemies you'll be fighting are easily handled as long as you have a source of lightning damage, which Ryuji is more than happy to provide.

Crossroads of Fate: Castle Arc - 1-2 Walkthrough

As the first mission where you'll actually get to explore, there are quite a few items to find scattered around the castle. Start by heading to the right, where there's a door that would lead down to the dungeons. There's a Golden Volleyball here to collect. Once you've got that, head up the main staircase and turn to the right to find a treasure chest. With both collectibles in this area handled, investigate the painting at the top of the staircase to open a path further into the castle.

Look left after reaching the stairs to find a Golden Volleyball, then head down the left set of stairs to find another treasure chest. Once you've got both of those, head up the stairs on the right and use the elevator to get into the tower. Take a left turn in the tower to find a boss enemy guarding a chest. This boss is vulnerable to Ice damage and shouldn't pose much of a threat. Take them out, open the chest, and head back to take the path to the right of where you came in.

After a cutscene plays, part of the floor will rise, creating a path for you to reach a chain higher up. Before you head over there, you should head around to the right and take out a Shadow to reach another treasure chest. Head back and climb up to the chain to pull it and open the gate. Once you head through the gate, a fight will start against Eligor, who is weak to Lightning and easy pickings for Ryuji. Take them out to finish the mission.

Crossroads of Fate: Castle Arc - 1-3 Walkthrough

This mission begins with the group heading outside the castle to find an alternate path into the west wing. After you get outside the castle, face the castle and look left to find the first Golden Volleyball and the first treasure chest of this mission. After entering the castle, climbing across some chandeliers, and ambushing some enemies that are very weak to Wind damage (Morgana really shines here), you can look to your right to find another treasure chest.

Head through the door the Shadows were guarding and, after turning a corner, you can find the second volleyball on a bookshelf to your left. Head through to the next room and use Wonder's Third Eye to follow the glowing footprints and pull the chains in order. Opening the chest in the center will start a fight against two Incubi, who are weak to both Bless and Gun attacks. This makes them easy pickings for Wonder and Janosik.

After taking out the enemy, head into the next hall and take out the enemies. The way forward is blocked by another chain puzzle you can solve using Third Eye, and there's a door to the right that requires a key to open. After solving the chain puzzle and seeing the cutscene explaining the locked door, head back the way you came to find the key on a bookshelf. Use it to crack open the door and find a treasure room guarded by some Shadows. They're weak to Ice and Lightning, and once you take them out, you'll have access to the three treasure chests they were guarding.

Once you've looted all the treasure, head back and go through the door opened by the chain puzzle to reach a staircase. Look to your right to get the final Volleyball, then head downstairs to finish the mission.

Crossroads of Fate: Castle Arc - 1-4 Walkthrough

Continuing the infiltration, you should head through the door right next to where you start this mission. This will take you to the bottom of the staircase from the last mission, which has now collapsed, and you can find a treasure chest and a Golden Volleyball here. With that taken care of, head back and follow the mission marker to reach the castle kitchens. Climbing up onto shelves and navigating past obstructions, you'll find a powerful enemy patrolling near a chain. Take them out and then pull the chain to extinguish the fireplace and lower the bars blocking the door. Grab the Orb of Greed/Golden Volleyball on the table near the chain, and make sure to open the treasure chest in the fireplace before you leave.

After heading around the corner in a small hallway, you'll enter a room where some Shadows are talking. After they split up and you regain control, take out the enemy in this room to snag a key. You'll need this to activate a chain in the room and open the path forward. Before you leave the room, however, you should also pick up the Golden Volleyball near where the Shadow was patrolling (on a shelf) and grab the nearby chest key so you can crack open the chest in this room.

Entering the next hallway, grab the chest at the end of the hall and then head through the door on your left. Exit this room into another hallway, grab the chest in that hallway, and then follow the mission marker to find the final battle of this mission. These enemies are weak to Ice damage. The Shadows mentioned that a female was captured and put in the underground prison, so we now know where Panther is.

Crossroads of Fate: Castle Arc - 1-5 Walkthrough

Our next objective is rescuing Panther in the underground prison. Starting out, follow the path and keep an eye out on your right, to spot the first Golden Volleyball inside a cell. After grabbing it, cross over the water to trigger a short cutscene. After the scene plays, head to the left to find a boss enemy guarding a chest. This turns out to be four Agathion, who are weak to Wind. Since Morgana can't hit multiple targets with his Wind attack, you'll need to take out two of them before you can start utilizing All-Out Attacks, unless you get lucky with Physical critical hits or bring along another party member with Wind skills.

Once they're down, open the chest and head back the way you came, stopping to open each cell you can on your left, taking out a Shadow in one and looting a treasure chest in another. Trigger the dialog about a locked door by heading over to the mission marker, then open the nearby cell and break some barrels to reveal a path forward. Investigate the clue Panther left behind in this room, then head out of the cell and turn right to find a treasure chest, and left to find another Orb of Greed.

After a fight with some enemies that are weak to Lightning, you can crack open the cell nearby for a second clue. Then, continue forward to find a chest, and hop across the water using the conveniently placed cages. Collect the last clue on the far side of the water, then head down the ramp and through the door, making sure to snag the Golden Volleyball on the left as you do. Find Panther in her cell just past this point to trigger a boss and finish up the mission. The boss is vulnerable to Fire.

Crossroads of Fate: Castle Arc - 1-6 Walkthrough

With Panther rescued, now we just need to find Joker. As we make our way through more of the underground prison, we'll encounter another strong enemy in our path. Luckily, with some Gunfire, and a Fire attack from Panther, they'll go down in no time at all. With them out of the way, we can check the cells on the left to find a strong enemy guarding a chest (who is weak to Ice), and pull a nearby chain to lower a bridge.

After crossing the Bridge, check the cells on your left to find a treasure chest in one, and a Golden Volleyball in another. Head up the stairs and look to your right to find the key for the Cell on your left. Take out the enemy inside and open the chest (the enemy in question is weak to lightning), then inspect the raised drawbridge up ahead. Once you've done that, you'll be able to open the cell next to the previous one, which contains an enemy holding the key for the pull chain.

Cross the Drawbridge and open all the cells on the other side, fighting some enemies and finding a treasure chest in the process. Then, head over toward the door leading to the final encounter of this area (Lufel will warn you to make sure you're prepared when you interact with it, so back out) and turn right to jump across some cages and reach the other side of the water. There's a Golden Volleyball here, along with the Hidden Room Key.

With the Hidden Room Key in hand, backtrack to just after the first drawbridge to find the locked room that it opens. Here, you'll find the last Golden Volleyball and a strong enemy guarding the last Treasure Chest. This enemy group is weak to lightning and fire, making them easy pickings for Panther and Skull. Once they're beaten, head back to the door leading to the final encounter and face off with the final enemy of this mission, which is weak to lightning.

Crossroads of Fate: Castle Arc - 1-7 Walkthrough

In this mission, we'll be returning to the west wing of the castle, visiting a location that is far too familiar to Panther. To get into the locked room, you'll need to acquire weapons and shields for the four knights who lack them. As you head out of the hall filled with suits of armor, look to your right to find a Golden Volleyball on a chair near a patrolling shadow. Once you've grabbed it, you can head down the hall toward the armory.

In the armory, you can immediately grab a spear from the wall on your right, and then wrap around to take out the patrolling shadow and open the nearby chest. Continue past the chest to find a second Golden Volleyball on a shelf on the far wall. Take out the other patrolling shadow and grab a second spear from the wall opposite where you found the first spear, and then head through the nearby door to continue.

In this hallway you'll find a Safe Room, which can be used to heal but won't allow you to change party members, and the first of the two shields you need. Through the door past the shield you'll find the kitchen. There's a patrolling shadow here, and after taking it out you can grab a Golden Volleyball from one of the tables and open a treasure chest inside the raised fireplace. When you interact with the statue holding the second shield, it will reveal itself to be a shadow and attack. Gun and Fire damage is the secret to success here, something you'll have in abundance now that Panther is here.

Once you've taken it out, use the shelves around the room to climb and reach the blocked-off section of the room, where another Golden Volleyball can be found on a shelf near a treasure chest and a door that cannot be opened. Now that you've got everything you need, head back to the door in the room with the statues, give the statues the weapons and shields, and then head into the final room of this mission. After a cutscene, you can open the chest in this room to get the Training Hall Key and trigger a boss fight. You'll be fighting two Berith and two Succubi, which are weak to Ice and Bless damage, respectively. This means it's time for Wonder to shine, and Morgana's Gentle Fist criticals can also be very effective here.

Crossroads of Fate: Castle Arc - 1-8 Walkthrough

Returning to the dungeons below the castle, the Phantom Thieves use the key from the previous mission to access Kamoshida's Training Hall of Love. After you gain control, you'll see a path leading straight ahead and a staircase leading downward. Taking the path straight ahead leads to a locked door, so we'll have to leave it for later. Instead, look to your right at the top of the stairs to find the first Golden Volleyball of this area, then head down and take out the patrolling shadow.

After you've dealt with the patrolling shadow, continue moving along the path and taking out enemies until you reach a door blocked by a shadow. Take it out, then check the side path to the right before you actually go through the door, since there's a treasure chest to grab.

Heading through the door, you'll reach a room with a chest in one corner, and the Hidden Room Key in the opposite corner. Open the chest, grab the key, and it's time to backtrack to the locked door we mentioned earlier. This hidden room contains a powerful shadow, a Golden Volleyball, and three treasure chests, making it well worth the trip. The enemy here is Eligor, who is weak to lightning and therefore a perfect target for Ryuji.

Once you've taken the enemy out and looted the room, head back to the room where you got the key and continue further into the Training Hall. After hearing a cry for help, you'll reach an area where a locked gate blocks the path forward. Look behind you after finding the locked gate to spot a Golden Volleyball, and then head through the gate on the opposite side of the water from the locked one to continue. Climb the boxes at the end of this path to get into a new section of the dungeon.

After you cross the rafters and get into a new set of hallways, turn around and take the path to your left to find another treasure chest. Heading back the way you came, you'll trigger a cutscene where Morgana points out a suspicious shadow. Take it out to grab the key, then head straight ahead down the path and look to your right at the end to find another chest, guarded by a powerful shadow. Most of the enemies in this fight are weak to guns, so it won't be too tough.

Once you've taken out the powerful shadow and opened the chest, look behind you to find another Golden Volleyball. You can then head back to where the shadow with the key was patrolling to open a gate leading back toward the locked gate from earlier. Open the locked gate to progress further and head to the end of this path to grab the final chest for this mission. With that, you can head back and investigate the noise to trigger the final fight of this mission.

The boss is an Archangel, meaning it's weak to lightning and curse, but you'll only need to drop its health to half to finish the mission and trigger the final cutscene. It seems we're in dire straits, but there's still an ace up our sleeve. Well, more of a Joker, really.

Crossroads of Fate: Castle Arc - 1-9 Walkthrough

This mission continues right where the last one left off, with the Phantom Thieves facing off against powerful foes and greatly outnumbered. Luckily, Joker arrives right on time to turn the tide. This is a fixed-party fight with Wonder and Joker versus Archangel, who begins the fight at half health and fights identically to last time. Joker can easily hit its weakness, as can Wonder if you brought any kind of lightning damage to the fight. Overall, Archangel should be no threat to Joker and Wonder fighting together.

Crossroads of Fate: Castle Arc - 1-10 Walkthrough

Returning to the upper levels of the Castle with Joker in tow, the Phantom Thieves will need to track down some baseballs to deactivate the trap blocking the path forward. We recommend making sure Wonder has Janosik equipped, along with Personas that can deal Fire, Ice, and/or Lightning damage, when starting this mission. You have Joker as a story-locked ally for this mission, who can deal a ton of AOE Curse Damage and take extra turns using his Will of Rebellion ability. Bringing along Cattle and Closer will round out the team nicely.

Heading downstairs from where you start, you can grab a Golden Volleyball on your left. Head through the door, and you'll see a Safe Room straight ahead. After unlocking it, look to the right to find a Golden Volleyball and a strong shadow. This enemy group is vulnerable to gun, lightning, and curse, so it shouldn't be a problem. Once they're dealt with, head through the door near where you got the Volleyball and fight past the Shadows to reach a pull chain.

Use the Pull Chain to open a side path that should look familiar, then take out the strong shadow to access the room behind them. Open the chest inside, then follow the mission marker to get to a new room. Climb the bookshelf and use it to get up to a window, exiting onto the castle roof. As you climb down the castle's battlements, you'll find another Golden Volleyball sitting on a box. The last Volleyball for this mission can be found just before you drop into the area with the box sliding puzzle, by taking a quick detour to the left at the spot shown in the last image, above.

Dropping into a large area with some moveable boxes, you'll need to solve a few basic puzzles to progress. The trick to each of these puzzles is to complete the pattern. For this first puzzle, push the box into the lower-right space to create an X shape. Take out the enemy patrolling just past it, then then grab the chest it was guarding. After that, you can push the nearby block into the spot shown in image 2, above, to complete the pattern and open the path forward.

Pull out the block on the left to open a path to another chest, then push the block into the spot shown in the first image, above. Push the block on the right into the position shown into the second image, and with both blocks in place you can challenge the final fight of this mission. Hit Eligor with lightning and Berith with ice to take them out quickly.

Crossroads of Fate: Castle Arc - 1-11 Walkthrough

Starting on a staircase, you'll want to begin by ignoring the mission marker and running all the way to the bottom of the stairs. You'll find an enemy and a treasure chest here, and then you can head back to where the mission marker is. This will lead you to a hallway with a gate on the right. Walk past the gate and turn the corner, taking out the patrolling Shadow along the way, and you can find a pull chain to open the gate.

Heading inside, you'll want to immediately head through the first door on your right, discovering a room with bookshelves. In one corner, on one of the shelves, is a Golden Volleyball. You can use the Pull Chain in this room to open a gate to another room in this hallway, and this will also close the gate you entered through. Head over to the newly opened gate and take out the Shadow in the room beyond, then grab another Golden Volleyball from the shelf to the right. With that done, pull the chain here to open both gates in the hall, then inspect the bookcase on the left to reveal a hidden chest.

On the bookshelf opposite the chest, you'll find the key to a locked door in the hall, leading to a room where another hidden chest can be found, behind a bookshelf. That's everything we can collect in this hall, so it's time to follow the mission marker and find the Chapel. In here, you can walk straight ahead after the cutscene to grab another treasure chest.

Once you've got the chest, jump across the platforms around the Pillars to reach the opposite Balcony, where a chain can be pulled to create a path across the upper section of the Chapel.

Follow the mission marker and use the path you created to reach the opposite side of the room, then drop down onto the nearby balcony to find a treasure chest, then look behind you after opening the chest to find a Golden Volleyball. With that done, follow the mission marker and climb across the platforms some more to reach the scaffolding behind the huge statue that watches over the chapel. Climb down the scaffolding and grab the baseball near the statue's feet to finish the mission.

Crossroads of Fate: Castle Arc - 1-12 Walkthrough

It's time to navigate the ground floor of the Chapel, and the best way to start is by clearing out the Shadows. Use the pews as cover to ambush the patrolling Shadows as you advance. After taking out the second patrolling Shadow, you can find a chest on one side, and a Golden Volleyball on the other (sitting on a pew), so make sure to pick them up as you head toward the far side of the room.

Pull the chain at the far side of the room to open the path forward, then turn right at the door leading further into the mission to find a side path. There's a chest on the left and a pull chain on the right. Pulling the chain will give you access to some movable blocks, so it's time for a block puzzle. Pull the first block back into the room with the pull chain, then push it into the position shown in the first image (below) to make the blocks vanish.

With those blocks out of the way, you can pull/push the other block into the main section of the chapel, and then into the spot shown in image 2 (above) to wipe out some more blocks. This will let you access a new area with a patrolling Shadow and another treasure chest. Once you've looted the chest, you can head further into this new area to find a Golden Volleyball and a pull chain that'll open all the metal gates in the chapel.

With everything collected in the Chapel, it's time to head through the door indicated by the mission marker, which will trigger an encounter with two Berith, and then Eligor. Berith are weak to Ice, while Eligor is vulnerable to Lightning, and neither enemy type should give you much trouble by this point if you're levelled up enough. After they're down, you'll immediately get thrown into a fight against Archangel and two Pixies. Luckily, Archangel is also weak to Lightning (and Curse), while Pixies can easily be handled with Ice or Gun attacks.

With the enemy defeated, you can grab a treasure chest from one corner of this room, and a Golden Volleyball sitting on a podium. With those collected, pull the chain nearby to open the gate blocking the exit, and head through to finish the mission.

Crossroads of Fate: Castle Arc - 1-13 Walkthrough

Continuing where the last mission left off, the Phantom Thieves emerge from the safe room after a short break to track down the last baseball. Follow the Mission Marker, taking out any Shadows in the way, until you see a treasure chest straight ahead. Take a quick detour to grab it, then continue following the mission marker to find the hallway shown in image 2. There's a chest at the end of it, so pick it up before heading through the marked door to continue the story. Beyond the marked door is a library, with a Golden Volleyball sitting on one of the tables.

Heading out to find the first book, head back the way you came and enter the door on the left, finding a book sitting on a bookshelf inside. From there, you can then use the movable blocks in the hall to open up a path further into the castle, by arranging them in the position shown in Image 2, above. Head around to the right after passing where the blocks were and push another block into position (image 3) to reveal a treasure chest, then go back the way you came and head down the left path to find a final block puzzle, which opens the way to a room containing a difficult fight.

This battle against Eligor and five Berith can cause a lot of trouble if you don't have AOE Ice damage and at least one party member with a lightning attack, but if you bring both with you, you'll be able to take them out fairly quickly with all-out attacks. Once they're dealt with, open the chest they were guarding and follow the mission marker to find a patrolling Shadow that holds another of the books you need.

This Shadow fight isn't too hard to handle, especially if you blast them with fire or gun damage to knock them down. Once defeated, you'll get the Book of Domination. The way forward is blocked by a new block puzzle, but you can use Third Eye to see exactly where each block needs to go, and thus which order you should move the green and yellow blocks in. Once you've gotten rid of all the blocks, you can turn the corner past them and find a Golden Volleyball sitting on a bookshelf. Continuing on, jumping atop some wooden blocks to do so, you'll have to take out another patrolling Shadow, and then deal with a second block puzzle.

Once again, use Third Eye to see the solution, and you can reach a room containing the final book you need, along with a Golden Volleyball. With both in hand, head back to the library to open the secret room. Inside you'll find the final battle for this mission, against a "Torn King of Desire." They're weak to Lightning, Psi, and Bless damage, and have quite a lot of health. Despite this, you can tear it down pretty quickly as long as you aren't underleveled (every enemy in this mission is at least level 50, with the boss being level 52).

Crossroads of Fate: Castle Arc - 1-14 Walkthrough

Right after entering this mission, turn to your left and head down the stairs to find a Golden Volleyball, then double back and use the baseballs to disable the swinging blade trap. Make sure to hop over and grab the chest halfway across the trap room, then proceed to the far side. Turn right and take out the patrolling Shadow so you can safely open the treasure chest. Behind the chest, you can move through a narrow gap in the wall behind to reach a grapple point, leading to one more chest.

Heading back, following the mission marker upstairs, follow this path straight ahead and past the door indicated by the marker to find an enemy guarding a Golden Volleyball and a treasure chest. Take them out and loot both, then head back toward the marked door. Next to this door, you can climb up on some pillars to reach a balcony overlooking the room beyond, where the last treasure chest can be found. Head back down and through the door to face the final boss of this event.

Boss Fight: Raga

Raga is a simple but dangerous opponent, and this fight can be broken into two main Phases. It's important to have a Medic on your team for this fight, and someone who can apply shields is also very helpful. In Phase 1, Raga will alternate between three different attacks, as shown below:

Attack

Effect

Golden Knife

Deal Physical Damage to 1 Foe.

Golden Fork

Deal Physical Damage to 1 Foe.

Tongue Whip

Deal Physical Damage to All Foes.

Golden Knife and Golden Fork both deal roughly the same amount of damage, while Tongue Whip deals a bit less damage but hits everyone. As long as you keep your party topped up on health and apply shields whenever you can, it shouldn't be too hard to drain Raga's first health bar (if he's taking out your party members in one blow, you should also apply defensive buffs, and potentially level up a bit more before taking this boss on). Once his first health bar is depleted, however, he'll begin using his treasure to strengthen himself, gaining a stat buff and a shield.

In order to beat Phase 2, you'll first need to focus your attacks on Raga's Crown, since until it's shattered he'll keep restoring his HP and reapplying the stat buff and shield. Raga will also periodically drink from his glass, prompting the text "Raga is Preparing..." When this text is displayed, it's important for all Party Members to block, since his next turn will have him use Gold Medal Spike to deal huge damage to the entire party. If the party is guarding, they'll take considerably less damage from this one. Other than that, the same strategies as before apply, so just keep chipping away to break the crown.

Remember that Raga's stat buffs are tied to having his shield, so if you deplete his shield it will also decrease the damage he deals, until he's able to renew it.

Once Raga's crown is broken, he'll immediately perform a weaker Gold Medal Spike, before returning to his attack pattern from phase 1. Once this happens, keep up the damage until he goes down.

item.title: Summer Games Done Quick Raises $2.4 Million For Charity
item.description:
Throughout the first full week of July, the Summer Games Done Quick (SGDQ) 2025 marathon event raised over $2.4 million for Doctors Without Borders, which is a similar amount raised during January's Awesome Games Done Quick event. The 2025 Summer Games Done Quick marathon was highlighted by speedruns of classic games like Sonic the Hedgehog 2 and Super Metroid , along with modern titles like Deltarune .

Usually held in late June to early July, Summer Games Done Quick is one of two mainline events hosted annually for charity by GDQ. Its headline marathon, Awesome Games Done Quick, takes place in early January. Between the charity marathons, GDQ also holds smaller events like Flame Fatales and Black In A Flash to give various speedrunners a chance to hone their craft. Additionally, Games Done Quick has hosted impromptu events as a response to natural disasters, such as Hurricane Helene in 2024. Games Done Quick broadcasts its charity events live on Twitch, with YouTube highlights of full game runs uploaded shortly after.

Six months after Awesome Games Done Quick 2025 raised money for the Prevent Cancer Foundation, its summer counterpart raised some remarkable donations of its own. From July 6 to 13, SGDQ 2025 raised over $2.4 million and counting for Doctors Without Borders, which is within $100,000 of the total raised during AGDQ 2025. According to the Doctors Without Borders mission statement, the organization brings medical care to people around the world who are affected by war, natural disasters, outbreaks, and displacement via conflict. Since 2013, SGDQ has raised donations for Doctors Without Borders, with its highest total coming in 2022 at over $3 million. The annual SGDQ event was held in Minneapolis and was kicked off by a run of Sonic the Hedgehog 2 . The classic Genesis title was completed by speedrunner SuperSonic in under 38 minutes.

Annual SGDQ Marathon Raises Over $2.4 Million For Doctors Without Borders

Other games featured during SGDQ 2025 were races from classics like Sonic Adventure 2 and Super Metroid , with the latter seeing speedrunners Eddie and Oatsngoats finish within two seconds of each other. Although it did not receive a remake for its 25th anniversary, Final Fantasy 9 was featured on the final day of SGDQ 2025. Despite a string of bad luck, speedrunner Sylleath completed the fan-favorite JRPG in under four hours.

The final game of SGDQ 2025 was Deltarune , which saw all four of its available chapters beaten by speedrunner Shayy in three hours and 45 minutes. Games Done Quick will return in full force in early January, as AGDQ 2026 returns to Pittsburgh.

item.title: Destiny 2 Fan Recreates Johnny Silverhand from Cyberpunk 2077
item.description:
One creative member of the Destiny 2 community online has shared their creation of an outfit inspired by Johnny Silverhand from Cyberpunk 2077 , including the armor and shaders used so that other fans can recreate the look for themselves. Destiny 2 's expansive range of cosmetic options has allowed players to base their Guardians' looks on countless other characters from all sorts of franchises over the years, but more importantly, they make it easy for every player to customize their Guardians to make them feel uniquely their own.

Players have shared similar amusing outfits in the past, with fans often discovering clever ways to utilize certain unusual armor pieces to dress their Guardians up as just about anyone from Shrek to Star Wars ' Admiral Ackbar. Some players have even gone beyond fictional characters and customized their Guardians to look like real-world celebrities, with one Destiny 2 fan fine-tuning their Guardian to look like Gordon Ramsay.

A popular custom outfit recently shared by the fan known as Shy_8 is based on Johnny Silverhand's iconic appearance from Cyberpunk 2077 . This outfit captures just about every part of the rockerboy's appearance - yes, including his defining cybernetic silver arm, which this Destiny 2 player managed to recreate as closely as they could in the game using the exotic Augmented Auspice gauntlets paired with the Ensilvered Snare shader. They also used the Superblack shader with the Extinction Orbit ornament for the chest piece and Obsidian Durasteel Titan mark to recreate Johnny's bulletproof vest, and used the Gamekeeper shader with the Ringwalker Greaves to capture the look of his leather pants - though any Hunters trying to recreate the Silverhand look should use the Lucky Pants exotic to recreate the character's lower half almost perfectly.

This Johnny Silverhand Outfit In Destiny 2 Isn't Too Hard For Players To Recreate

This Destiny 2 outfit also features a helmet despite Johnny wearing nothing on his face aside from his aviator sunglasses, but this ultimately might be the right call. Even more than a decade after Destiny 2 's launch, the game's actual character face customization options are pretty shallow, and many players feel like their Guardians look much better in-game with their helmets on at all times.

With Destiny 2 's fantastic Final Shape era and ensuing episodes having finally drawn to a close, the game is just a matter of days away from kicking off a new chapter with its upcoming Edge of Fate expansion, which will throw players into a wild new story that may be a bit of a far cry from what they're used to in the Destiny 2 universe. Many of the game's fundamental components - such as UI, character stats, power levels, and more - are due for a bit of an overhaul as Destiny 2 enters a brave new saga, and with plenty of new content set to arrive throughout 2025 and beyond, fashion enthusiasts should look forward to loads more armor pieces and shaders that will help them craft even more new outfits going forward.
